chunks.content: Item Setup Process: Search for similar items to get sequential item number. Go to empty item screen, press F1, enter a number from similar items. Press A to begin entering. chunks.content: Item Setup key fields: Field 6 (Billing Type): 1=by case, 2=by weight (LB/OZ), 3=catchweight (variable weight like 4-7 LBs). Field 8 (Pieces per case): Enter split quantity or 1 if no split. Generally avoid splits except sturdy self-contained items (gallon jugs of mayo/oil OK, loose fry bags NO). Fields 10/11: Net/gross weight. Field 14: Case cube. Field 17: Landed cost.

chunks.content: Item Lockout codes (Field 43): X=Cannot key out until back in stock AND/OR on order (sales can key if on order based on ETA). Y=Locked to everyone, no keying unless inventory on hand. S=Locked out to BOE only. D=Locked out to street sales only.

jargon.keying: Entering or processing a sale/order for an item
jargon.back in stock: Item replenished and available in inventory
jargon.on order: Item has a purchase order placed with supplier

chunks.content: Item special flags: Field 45 (Taxable): Food items=N, non-food items may be Y. Field 46 (DWO - Done When Out): Item will not be reordered, discontinued by Driscoll or manufacturer. Field 47 (Special Order): N=stocked item, Y=brought in for specific purpose/won't move (adds burden to item). Field 53 (Exclude Special): Y ensures special item mark won't fall off.

chunks.content: Add Vendor Allowances: In Purchase Order Menu, go to 28 (Vendor Master File Maintenance), select AL. First complete Header (H): Affect Totals (Y=deduct from invoice total, N=no effect), COG (Y=deduct from cost of goods/received cost, N=no effect), Total PO (0 for individual items, negative $ to apply to all items).

chunks.content: Item Allowances/Charges: Select C, enter 6-digit item#, choose #1 for allowance or #3 for charge. Select basis: Case price, Net weight, Catch weight, Percentage, or Gross weight. Select #2 to add allowance value or #4 for charge value. Allowance deducts from COG, Charge adds to COG. Up arrow then Y to finish. To apply to open PO, go into PO and enter through items.

chunks.content: Freight Fields usage: Freight Allowance 1 = Pickup with allowance that nets down on invoice. Freight Allowance 2 = Pickup allowance NOT netted on invoice (bill back). Freight Charge 1 = Pickup (no invoice effect) OR delivery freight that DOES affect PO. Freight Charge 2 = Delivery freight that does NOT affect invoice. Always review PO freight screen before confirming. Contact manager if uncertain.
synthetic_questions: What does Freight Allowance 1 mean for pickups?

jargon.Freight Allowance 1: Pickup with allowance that nets down on invoice
jargon.Freight Allowance 2: Pickup allowance NOT netted on invoice (bill back)
jargon.Freight Charge 1: Pickup (no invoice effect) OR delivery freight that DOES affect PO
jargon.Freight Charge 2: Delivery freight that does NOT affect invoice
jargon.PO freight screen: Screen in the Purchase Order displaying freight details
